017package org.microbean.loader;
018
019import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
020
021import java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler;
022import java.lang.reflect.Method;
023import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
024import java.lang.reflect.Parameter;
025import java.lang.reflect.Proxy;
026import java.lang.reflect.Type;
027
028import java.util.Arrays;
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.Collections;
031import java.util.List;
032import java.util.Map;
033import java.util.Objects;
034import java.util.TreeMap;
035
036import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
037import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
038
039import java.util.function.BiFunction;
040import java.util.function.Supplier;
041
042import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
043
044import org.microbean.invoke.OptionalSupplier;
045import org.microbean.invoke.OptionalSupplier.Determinism;
046
047import org.microbean.loader.api.Loader;
048
049import org.microbean.loader.spi.AbstractProvider;
050import org.microbean.loader.spi.LoaderFacade;
051import org.microbean.loader.spi.Value;
052
053import org.microbean.path.Path;
054import org.microbean.path.Path.Element;
055
056import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualifiers;
057
058import org.microbean.type.JavaTypes;
059
060/**
061 * An {@link AbstractProvider} that is capable of {@linkplain Proxy
062 * proxying} {@linkplain #isProxiable(Loader, Path) certain}
063 * interfaces and supplying them as environmental objects.
064 *
065 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
066 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
067 *
068 * @see #get(Loader, Path)
069 *
070 * @see #isProxiable(Loader, Path)
071 */
072public class ProxyingProvider extends AbstractProvider {
073
074
075  /*
076   * Instance fields.
077   */
078
079
080  private final ConcurrentMap<Path<? extends Type>, Object> proxies;
081
082
083  /*
084   * Constructors.
085   */
086
087
088  /**
089   * Creates a new {@link ProxyingProvider}.
090   *
091   * @deprecated This constructor should be invoked by subclasses and
092   * {@link java.util.ServiceLoader} instances only.
093   */
094  @Deprecated // intended for use by subclasses and java.util.ServiceLoader only
095  public ProxyingProvider() {
096    super();
097    this.proxies = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
098  }
099
100
101  /*
102   * Instance methods.
103   */
104
105
106  @Override // Provider
107  protected Supplier<?> find(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
108    assert absolutePath.absolute();
109    assert absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.path());
110    assert !absolutePath.equals(requestor.path());
111    if (this.isProxiable(requestor, absolutePath)) {
112      return
113        OptionalSupplier.of(Determinism.PRESENT,
114                            () -> this.proxies.computeIfAbsent(absolutePath,
115                                                               p -> this.newProxyInstance(requestor, p, JavaTypes.erase(p.qualified()))));
116    }
117    return null;
118  }
119
120
121  /**
122   * Returns {@code true} if the {@linkplain Path#qualified() type
123   * identified by the supplied <code>absolutePath</code>} can be
124   * proxied.
125   *
126   * <p>A type can be proxied by this {@link ProxyingProvider} if its
127   * {@linkplain JavaTypes#erase(Type) type erasure}:</p>
128   *
129   * <ul>
130   *
131   * <li>is an {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface}</li>
132   *
133   * <li>is {@linkplain Class#isHidden() not hidden}</li>
134   *
135   * <li>is {@linkplain Class#isSealed() not sealed}</li>
136   *
137   * </ul>
138   *
139   * <p>In addition, the default implementation of this method rules
140   * out interfaces that declare or inherit {@code public} instance
141   * methods with either exactly one parameter that does not pass the
142   * test codified by the {@link #isIndexLike(Class)} method or more
143   * than one parameter.</p>
144   *
145   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} seeking an environmental
146   * object; must not be {@code null}; ignored by the default
147   * implementation of this method
148   *
149   * @param absolutePath the {@link Path} {@linkplain Path#qualified()
150   * identifying the interface to be proxied}; must not be {@code
151   * null}; must be {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
152   *
153   * @return {@code true} if the {@linkplain Path#qualified() type
154   * identified by the supplied <code>absolutePath</code>} can be
155   * proxied; {@code false} otherwise
156   *
157   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code
158   * null}
159   *
160   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code absolutePath} is
161   * not {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
162   *
163   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
164   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
165   *
166   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
167   * idempotent and deterministic.
168   *
169   * @see #isIndexLike(Class)
170   *
171   * @see #isProxiable(Class)
172   */
173  public boolean isProxiable(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
174    return this.isProxiable(absolutePath.qualified());
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link Type} can be
179   * proxied.
180   *
181   * <p>A {@link Type} can be proxied if it:</p>
182   *
183   * <ul>
184   *
185   * <li>is not {@code null}</li>
186   *
187   * <li>represents an {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface}</li>
188   *
189   * <li>is {@linkplain Class#isHidden() not hidden}</li>
190   *
191   * <li>is {@linkplain Class#isSealed() not sealed}</li>
192   *
193   * </ul>
194   *
195   * <p>In addition, the default implementation of this method rules
196   * out interfaces that declare or inherit {@code public} instance
197   * methods with either exactly one parameter that does not pass the
198   * test codified by the {@link #isIndexLike(Class)} method or more
199   * than one parameter.</p>
200   *
201   * <p>This method does not, and its overrides must not, call the
202   * {@link #isProxiable(Loader, Path)} method or undefined behavior
203   * (such as an infinite loop) may result.</p>
204   *
205   * @param type the {@link Type} to test; may be {@code null} in which
206   * case {@code false} will be returned
207   *
208   * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link Type} can be
209   * proxied; {@code false} otherwise
210   *
211   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
212   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
213   *
214   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
215   * idempotent and deterministic.
216   *
217   * @see #isIndexLike(Class)
218   */
219  public boolean isProxiable(final Type type) {
220    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(type);
221    if (c != null && c.isInterface() && !c.isHidden() && !c.isSealed()) {
222      final LoaderFacade facadeAnnotation = c.getAnnotation(LoaderFacade.class);
223      if (facadeAnnotation == null || facadeAnnotation.value()) {
224        final Method[] methods = c.getMethods();
225        switch (methods.length) {
226        case 0:
227          // Interface with no methods.
228          return false;
229        default:
230          int getterCount = 0;
231          int defaultCount = 0;
232          for (final Method m : methods) {
233            if (m.isDefault()) {
234              // Found a default method.
235              ++defaultCount;
236            } else if (!Modifier.isStatic(m.getModifiers())) {
237              // Found an abstract instance method.
238              final Type returnType = m.getReturnType();
239              if (returnType != void.class && returnType != Void.class) {
240                // Found an abstract instance method that returns something other than void.
241                switch (m.getParameterCount()) {
242                case 0:
243                  // It has no parameters, so it's a getter.
244                  ++getterCount;
245                  break;
246                case 1:
247                  if (!this.isIndexLike(m.getParameterTypes()[0])) {
248                    // It has one parameter, and that parameter is not
249                    // "index-like", so we don't know what to do with
250                    // it.
251                    return false;
252                  }
253                  // It has one parameter, and that parameter is
254                  // "index-like", so we could conceivably implement
255                  // it with a map or a list.  Keep going.
256                  ++getterCount;
257                  break;
258                default:
259                  // It has more than one parameter so we don't know
260                  // what to do with it.
261                  return false;
262                }
263              }
264            }
265          }
266          return getterCount > 0 || defaultCount > 0;
267        }
268
269      }
270    }
271    return false;
272  }
273
274  /**
275   * Returns a {@link Path} suitable for the combination of the
276   * supplied {@link Loader} and requested {@link Path}.
277   *
278   * @param <T> the type of the requested and returned {@link Path}s
279   *
280   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} issuing the current request;
281   * must not be {@code null}; ignored by this implementation
282   *
283   * @param absolutePath the {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
284   * {@link Path} representing the current request; must not be {@code
285   * null}
286   *
287   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link Path} with which any {@link
288   * Value} provided by this {@link ProxyingProvider} will be
289   * associated
290   *
291   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
292   * return {@code null}.
293   *
294   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
295   * idempotent but not necessarily deterministic.
296   *
297   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
298   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
299   */
300  @Override // AbstractProvider
301  protected <T extends Type> Path<T> path(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<T> absolutePath) {
302    return Path.of(absolutePath.qualified());
303  }
304
305  /**
306   * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@link Class} representing a
307   * method parameter is <em>index-like</em>, i.e. if it is something
308   * typically used as an index into a larger collection or map.
309   *
310   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns {@code true}
311   * if {@code parameterType} represents either an {@code int}, an
312   * {@link Integer}, or a {@link CharSequence}.</p>
313   *
314   * <p>This method is called by the default implementation of the
315   * {@link #isProxiable(Loader, Path)} method.</p>
316   *
317   * @param parameterType the method parameter type to test; may be
318   * {@code null} in which case {@code false} will be returned
319   *
320   * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@link Class} representing a
321   * method parameter is <em>index-like</em>, i.e. if it is something
322   * typically used as an index into a larger collection or map
323   *
324   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
325   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
326   *
327   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
328   * idempotent and deterministic.
329   */
330  protected boolean isIndexLike(final Class<?> parameterType) {
331    return
332      parameterType == int.class ||
333      parameterType == Integer.class ||
334      CharSequence.class.isAssignableFrom(parameterType);
335  }
336
337  /**
338   * Invokes the {@link Proxy#newProxyInstance(ClassLoader, Class[],
339   * InvocationHandler)} method with appropriate arguments and returns
340   * the result.
341   *
342   * <p>The {@link Proxy#newProxyInstance(ClassLoader, Class[],
343   * InvocationHandler)} method is invoked with the following
344   * arguments:</p>
345   *
346   * <ol>
347   *
348   * <li>{@code interfaceToProxy.getClassLoader()}</li>
349   *
350   * <li>{@code new Class<?>[] { interfaceToProxy }}</li>
351   *
352   * <li>a special {@link InvocationHandler} backed by the supplied
353   * {@link Loader} and {@link Path}</li>
354   *
355   * </ol>
356   *
357   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} performing the current
358   * request; must not be {@code null}
359   *
360   * @param absolutePath an {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
361   * {@link Path} representing the current request; must not be {@code
362   * null}
363   *
364   * @param interfaceToProxy the single interface the new proxy
365   * instance will implement; must not be {@code null}; must be an
366   * interface
367   *
368   * @return a new proxy instance as produced by the {@link
369   * Proxy#newProxyInstance(ClassLoader, Class[], InvocationHandler)}
370   * method; never {@code null}
371   *
372   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
373   *
374   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if any argument is unsuitable
375   *
376   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
377   * return {@code null}.
378   *
379   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
380   * idempotent and deterministic.
381   *
382   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
383   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
384   *
385   * @see Proxy#newProxyInstance(ClassLoader, Class[], InvocationHandler)
386   */
387  protected Object newProxyInstance(final Loader<?> requestor,
388                                    final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath,
389                                    final Class<?> interfaceToProxy) {
390    return
391      Proxy.newProxyInstance(interfaceToProxy.getClassLoader(),
392                             new Class<?>[] { interfaceToProxy },
393                             new Handler(requestor, absolutePath, (m, args) -> path(m, args)));
394  }
395
396
397  /*
398   * Static methods.
399   */
400
401
402  private static final Path<? extends Type> path(final Method m, final Object[] args) {
403    final Map<String, Object> map;
404    final Parameter[] parameters = m.getParameters();
405    if (parameters.length > 0) {
406      if (args.length != parameters.length) {
407        throw new IllegalArgumentException("args: " + args);
408      }
409      map = new TreeMap<>();
410      for (int i = 0; i < parameters.length; i++) {
411        map.put(parameters[i].getName(), String.valueOf(args[i]));
412      }
413    } else {
414      map = Collections.emptySortedMap();
415    }
416    final Type type = m.getGenericReturnType();
417    return Path.of(Element.of(Qualifiers.of(map), type, propertyName(m.getName(), boolean.class == type)));
418  }
419
420  /**
421   * Given a {@link CharSequence} normally representing the name of a
422   * "getter" method, and a {@code boolean} indicating whether the
423   * method in question returns a {@code boolean}, applies the rules
424   * declared by the Java Beans specification to the name and yields
425   * the result.
426   *
427   * @param cs a {@link CharSequence} naming a "getter" method; may be
428   * {@code null} in which case {@code null} will be returned
429   *
430   * @param methodReturnsBoolean {@code true} if the method named by
431   * the supplied {@link CharSequence} has {@code boolean} as its
432   * return type
433   *
434   * @return the property name corresponding to the supplied method
435   * name, according to the rules of the Java Beans specification, or
436   * {@code null} (only if {@code cs} is {@code null})
437   *
438   * @nullability This method may return {@code null} but only when
439   * {@code cs} is {@code null}.
440   *
441   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
442   * threads.
443   *
444   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
445   *
446   * @see #decapitalize(CharSequence)
447   */
448  @Convenience
449  public static final String propertyName(final CharSequence cs, final boolean methodReturnsBoolean) {
450    if (cs == null) {
451      return null;
452    } else {
453      final int length = cs.length();
454      if (length > 3) {
455        switch (cs.charAt(0)) {
456        case 'g':
457          if (cs.charAt(1) == 'e' && cs.charAt(2) == 't') {
458            // getFoo() -> decapitalize("Foo")
459            return decapitalize(cs.subSequence(3, length));
460          }
461          break;
462        default:
463          break;
464        }
465      } else if (methodReturnsBoolean && length > 2) {
466        switch (cs.charAt(0)) {
467        case 'i':
468          if (cs.charAt(1) == 's') {
469            // isFoo() -> decapitalize("Foo")
470            return decapitalize(cs.subSequence(2, length));
471          }
472          break;
473        default:
474          break;
475        }
476      }
477      return decapitalize(cs);
478    }
479  }
480
481  /**
482   * Decapitalizes the supplied {@link CharSequence} according to the
483   * rules of the Java Beans specification.
484   *
485   * @param cs the {@link CharSequence} to decapitalize; may be {@code
486   * null} in which case {@code null} will be returned
487   *
488   * @return the decapitalized {@link String} or {@code null}
489   *
490   * @nullability This method may return {@code null} but only when
491   * {@code cs} is {@code null}.
492   *
493   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
494   * threads.
495   *
496   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
497   */
498  public static final String decapitalize(final CharSequence cs) {
499    if (cs == null) {
500      return null;
501    }
502    final String s = cs.toString(); // for atomicity
503    switch (s.length()) {
504    case 0:
505      return s;
506    case 1:
507      return s.toLowerCase();
508    default:
509      if (Character.isUpperCase(s.charAt(1))) {
510        if (Character.isUpperCase(s.charAt(0))) {
511          return s;
512        }
513      } else if (Character.isLowerCase(s.charAt(0))) {
514        return s;
515      }
516      final char[] chars = s.toCharArray();
517      chars[0] = Character.toLowerCase(chars[0]);
518      return String.valueOf(chars);
519    }
520  }
521
522
523  /*
524   * Inner and nested classes.
525   */
526
527
528  private static final class Handler implements InvocationHandler {
529
530    /**
531     * A {@link Loader} whose {@link Loader#of(Path)} method will
532     * eventually be called by the {@link #invoke(Object, Method,
533     * Object[])} method.
534     *
535     * <p>Note that this {@link Loader}'s {@link Loader#path()} method
536     * will return a {@link Path} that <em>does not identify</em> the
537     * actual interface being proxied, much less the {@link Method}
538     * being handled by this {@link Handler}.  The {@link
539     * #absolutePath} field, instead, contains the {@link Path}
540     * identifying the proxied interface (and it will {@linkplain
541     * Path#startsWith(Path) start with} the return value of {@link
542     * #requestor requestor.path()}).  During execution of the {@link
543     * #invoke(Object, Method, Object[])} method, the contents of the
544     * {@link #absolutePath} field will be appended with a relative
545     * {@link Path} corresponding to the {@link Method} being handled,
546     * and <em>that</em> resulting absolute {@link Path} will be
547     * supplied to the {@link Loader#of(Path)} method.  Note further
548     * that the {@link Loader#of(Path)} method will internally adjust
549     * the <em>actual</em> {@link Loader} used (see {@link
550     * Loader#loaderFor(Path)}).</p>
551     *
552     * <p>All of this to say: this {@link Loader} is just a handle of
553     * sorts to the proper {@link Loader} that will eventually be used
554     * to locate the environmental object corresponding to the return
555     * value of the {@link Method} being handled, and serves no other
556     * purpose.</p>
557     *
558     * @see #absolutePath
559     *
560     * @see #invoke(Object, Method, Object[])
561     */
562    private final Loader<?> requestor;
563
564    private final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath;
565
566    private final BiFunction<? super Method, ? super Object[], ? extends Path<? extends Type>> pathFunction;
567
568    private Handler(final Loader<?> requestor,
569                    final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath,
570                    final BiFunction<? super Method, ? super Object[], ? extends Path<? extends Type>> pathFunction) {
571      super();
572      if (!absolutePath.absolute()) {
573        throw new IllegalArgumentException("!absolutePath.absolute(): " + absolutePath);
574      } else if (!absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.path())) {
575        throw new IllegalArgumentException("!absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.path()); absolutePath: " + absolutePath +
576                                           "; requestor.path(): " + requestor.path());
577      } else if (absolutePath.equals(requestor.path())) {
578        throw new IllegalArgumentException("absolutePath.equals(requestor.path()): " + absolutePath);
579      }
580      this.requestor = requestor;
581      this.absolutePath = absolutePath;
582      this.pathFunction = Objects.requireNonNull(pathFunction, "pathFunction");
583
584    }
585
586    @Override // InvocationHandler
587    public final Object invoke(final Object proxy, final Method m, final Object[] args) throws ReflectiveOperationException {
588      if (m.getDeclaringClass() == Object.class) {
589        return
590          switch (m.getName()) {
591          case "hashCode" -> System.identityHashCode(proxy);
592          case "equals" -> proxy == args[0];
593          case "toString" -> proxy.getClass().getName() + "@" + Integer.toHexString(System.identityHashCode(proxy));
594          default -> throw new AssertionError("method: " + m);
595          };
596      } else {
597        final Object returnType = m.getReturnType();
598        if (returnType == void.class || returnType == Void.class) {
599          return defaultValue(proxy, m, args);
600        } else {
601          final Path<? extends Type> path = this.pathFunction.apply(m, args);
602          assert path.qualified() == returnType : "path.qualified() != returnType: " + path.qualified() + " != " + returnType;
603          assert !path.absolute() : "path.absolute(): " + path;
604          final OptionalSupplier<Object> s = this.requestor.load(this.absolutePath.plus(path));
605          return s.orElseGet(() -> defaultValue(proxy, m, args));
606        }
607      }
608    }
609
610    private static final Object defaultValue(final Object proxy, final Method m, final Object[] args) {
611      if (m.isDefault()) {
612        try {
613          // If the current method is a default method of the proxied
614          // interface, invoke it.
615          return InvocationHandler.invokeDefault(proxy, m, args);
616        } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException | Error e) {
617          throw e;
618        } catch (final Exception e) {
619          throw new UnsupportedOperationException(m.getName(), e);
620        } catch (final Throwable e) {
621          throw new AssertionError(e.getMessage(), e);
622        }
623      } else {
624        // We have no recourse.
625        throw new UnsupportedOperationException(m.toString());
626      }
627    }
628
629  }
630
631}
